item.title: Minimize global process
item.description: Global consistency comes at the cost of autonomy; be careful not to stifle what could be your most effective teams Earlier this week, I was discussing Platform Engineering with some other technical leaders. Someone suggested that one of the main benefits of an effective Platform was “reducing duplicate effort for developers”, to which another replied: I have worked for a company that forced all engineers to use the same shitty CI/CD system.

item.title: Striped development
item.description: Incremental progress on large projects can be achieved by developing functional stripes across the system's components. When planning the delivery of a software project, there are many different strategies for handling the design and implementation of the system. At the extremes, we could attempt to complete a fully-specified design before writing any code at all, or we could start writing code without putting any thought towards our design and architecture at all.
